channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4718] Vouchers - nothing happens when a certain voucher code is given
item.description:
andre.hoffmann@distrelec.com
sap@distrelec

Kunder Nummer in SAP: 1241009

Free goods voucher: type of deal in SAP: 50
a voucher that applies to all customers: type of code: 00 (general)
validity timeframe: 01.08.2014 - 30.08.2014

Reusable code
Campaign number: KXtTRyK1yS
Material: 14021377
the campaign was: when someone buys 10 pieces, they become 2 for free.

when given in the webshop, nothing happends
item.summary: Vouchers - nothing happens when a certain voucher code is given

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
with order calculation for that customer we receive from SAP the information that the voucher is not valid:

<vouchers>
	<code>KXtTRyK1yS</code>
	<fixedValue>0.0</fixedValue>
	<valid>false</valid>
</vouchers>

This situation is generating a 500 error.

I'm going to fix on hybris side and avoid to get a 500 error, but in SAP the voucher code is not valid.

Hi Ligia

is it possible that you take a look at this issue. According to Francesco this is an error from SAP.

Multumesc frumos!

Hi Francesco,

Please specify in which system is this happening.

Best Regards,
Ligia
New SAP Quality system

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4251] CatalogPlus items not available in LT
item.description:
The catalogplus items are not available in LT.

Please check:

  • Assortment
  • FF indexes.
item.summary: CatalogPlus items not available in LT

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
@Francesco: Can you please import sales status information for LT catalog+ products and also the prices for LTL. Thanks.
I'll take care of the FactFinder config
Any update on this, has the stales status info for LT C+ been imported?
The import job is still running.

The import is done, the products are visible. However by a FactFinder search it seems they are not found, e.g. http://www.distrelec.lt/lt/boxxser-55-4x4-11-Raaco---138284/p/serviceplus/90209085

Raphael, do we need to start an FF export?
To be done along with DISTRELEC-3769
I close this ticket, as the products are available. There is still an issue with the search, but this one get generally optimized with DISTRELEC-3769, as Nando has already mentioned.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4756] SAP // Address handling in check out
item.description:
Check and solve the address issues in check out as described in the wiki:
https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/G129+-+Address+Display+Patterns
item.summary: SAP // Address handling in check out

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Jan,
i've implemented some changes, and now in the checkout address page all the addresses are always available.
To summarize, in the model you'll find the following attributes:

  • shippingAddresses: all the shipping addresses, also the one flagged as billing and shipping.
  • billingAddresses: all the billing addresses, also the one flagged as billing and shipping

In case a B2B Key Account has multiple billing addresses, then no address is set as default in cartData.billingAddress model attribute and the billing address list is displayed. This should be already implemented and working.
Frontend is done.

item.summary: Education meets experience form // add captcha

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Development has been done and it#s ready for testing now

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4581] Search Result: Implement Technical View
item.description:
A new product list pattern "technical view" (along the existing normal list pattern) needs to be implemented as specified here:

https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/903+-+Search+Result+Technical+View

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: If reasonable, DISTRELEC-2052 should also be covered with the refactoring.
url that contains products local: http://distrelec-ch.local:9001/de/Stromversorgung-%26-Licht/Batterien-Ladeger%C3%A4te-Regenerativ/Ladeger%C3%A4te/c/cat-L3D_525546

The Technical View will be on the following pages:

  • all search result
  • product hierarchy pages (including the new product family view)
  • product lists that are part of the detail page (similar products)

Open TODO:

Backend:

  • Store current view property in Cookie and deliver the property on every call for products (Search Page, Category Page, Ajax Facet, Show More, View Switch)
  • Deliver 10 Top A Attributes as a List containing Hashmaps, each Hashmap needs to reflect one Attribute with key being label and value being the attribute value

Frontend:

  • Display Correct Technical Attributes in technical View
  • Check if the switch works with Ajax Facets, Show more and on all Pages where it should be
Property viewType wird entweder "standard" oder "technical"

The attributes that need to be delivered for the technical view are:
Top 10 WebUseA and WebUseB attributes (B only if there are less than 10 A attributes. If A and B combined are less than 10, the remaining spots stay empty)

EDIT:
Top 10 WebUse attributes as per WebUse attribute sequence of FactFinder (per category). If there are fewer than 10 WebUse attributes on a product, the remaining spots stay empty.
This feature will be implemented in an own feature branch: /branches/feature-rle-4581-technical-view

Changed Order of the webuse-Attributes in the Factfinder-Export. The Attributes will be sorted by the Position on the ClassAttributeAssignment.

This should also speed up the export and should be tested on DEV tomorrow.

==> The attributes will now be delievered from Factfinder in the new order but there are no speed improvements for the exports (all CH-Exports on DEV run about 30 minutes - as before)

TODO from FE Perspective:

  • Use Correct Icons for Buttons when delivered from Florian
  • Check if EOL / Not buyable products are being displayed at Similar Products. If yes, they need additional formatting, since there is currently only the template product-detail-page.jsp which was optimized for the technical view, since products there are always in technical view.
As of the decision of Florian, EOL / Not buyable Products should always be displayed in standard view, even if the actual user switched to technical view.

Decision from Florian: EOL products shall NOT be visible in the list of similar products on a product detail page.
@Jan: No additional template for similar products is required.
@Remo: Please remove (filter) EOL products from the list of similar products on the detail page. --> done
Icons: Please use original HV icons for the time being, so that the functionality can already be tested in Q. The designer is on holiday and will return only next week.

• Images to be changed (see sub-task).
  • Implemented. Please test.
Other Issue: After switching from standard to technical View, the product family link is wrong (Some error with the templating) i will fix that also.

Hi Jan,
Please wait with starting to fix the design issue.
First I would like to discuss about it with Nando.
Thx.

Discussed with Jan and Florian, please do the following:

  • introduce separate properties for the product family link, one for the normal view ("Produktfamilie"), and one for the technical view ("Familie")
  • In the tech view, please shorten the type so that it doesn't break the line when too long.

Separate Properties are introduced, type gets shortened in technical view if too long.
Can be tested after next deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4440] List price for some article not visible
item.description:
Reported from Entcho.Evanov@distrelec.com (KAM in CH-fr)

The article 841670 (12511808 - Standard mouse pad blue, 29700, Maxxtro) has a list price of CHF 5.56. (see screenshot "anonymous")
If the user "schweiz_test" (get password from Florian) is logged in, he can see the list price in the search result, but not on the detail page anymore. (see screenshot "logged-in")

On the details page he can only see the "Your price" which is CHF 2.50 due to a scale shift. (see screenshot "scaleshift")

@Florian:

  • Do we need to show the "List price" on the detail page, too?
  • If yes, what about the priority of this ticket? (best/fastest solved by Raphael Husi)
  • Do we have a similar problem in case of a % rebate model (e.g. D1RAB010)?
item.summary: List price for some article not visible

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: We should show the List Price and the Your Price also for Scale Shifts.
Please check the fix for the recalculation box

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4340] Checkout tracking in FF not correct
item.description: In my current search report (7.5. - 6.6. CH-DE) I have items with a very high Checkout Value, which is simply unrealistic. Could you please check if there is a mistake in the tracking? Or where these figures come from? Especially the * searches generate high figures in every report.
item.summary: Checkout tracking in FF not correct

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Added frontend stuff, but when I do an add to cart with the new parameter, I currently get a nullpointer exception..back to you Raphi.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4322] Merge 2 Webtrekk.impex-files per Country-Catalogue into 1 file / Move file into Deployment-'Essentials'
item.description:
-> Pre-discussed with Raphael Husi and Rafael Burlet:

Please merge the 2 Webtrekk.impex-files per Country-Catalogue into 1 Webtrekk.impex-file and move the according Webtrekk.impex-file into Hybris Deployment-'Essentials' area in order to ensure that the contained script and pre-configs are implemented automatically (no manual routine) with every deployment. This shall also apply when a Catalogue is initialised.

Please note that the indicated above is dependent on the 'environment'-area:

  • DEV/STAGE/PROD (meaning everything pre-Live): 1 merged Webtrekk.impex-file equivalent for all Countries (the script and configs you can find in the ticket DISTRELEC-3568 -> webtrekk_test_v3.js and Stage-environment_initial-WT-Properties_MDI_v1.0_14-06-04.txt)
  • LIVE: 1 merged Webtrekk.impex-file individual per Country (the script you can find in the ticket DISTRELEC-3568 -> webtrekk_v3.js / the configs for the Countries which are already LIVE are already provided - before upcoming Go-Lives I am going to provide an according .txt-file containing dedicated configs specific per Country to be implemented)

Thx Mark
item.summary: Merge 2 Webtrekk.impex-files per Country-Catalogue into 1 file / Move file into Deployment-'Essentials'

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Raphi, Could you please give me an estimation?
Thx.

We can merge the most things to one file, but we still need to files. The reason is, that the CMS pages not get created in the core extensions, they get created in the initialdata extension. So we just can merge the settings that are based on the CMSsite itself but not for selected CMS pages. This information will stay in a separated file and if we need changes on that, we still have to import them manually via post installations.

Thanks for your proposal. Fine for me - please proceed accordingly.

Regarding the mentioned separated file (CMS page configs), could you possibly attach a file-draft in this regard in order for me to get an idea about its structure?

Thx Mark

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3800] Heatmap Ref-Point Implementation
item.description: To be implemented as specified in the attached .doc-file

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: To be tested on Test environment

Hi Ruben

Currently deployed as shown on the attached screenshot. However this should be implemented on the top left of the template as specified. Please refactor.

Please note that this has already been deployed to LIVE as well!

Mark
Tested locally OK, screenshot attached

By when will that be deployed on Q?
My screenshot is referring to the current implementation on Q (test.distrelec.ch). Please verify there.
In addition: It seems that the current implementation on Q (according to my screenshot) is currently 'only' referring to Home. Required: To be implemented accordingly on every webpage.

Thx Mark

Hello,
This ticket is part of Sprint 1.
Please contact Florian for the dates in Q.
I have checked locally, and every webpage has this new id

Ciao Flo

Bitte mit Ruben ansehen. Ich kann auf lokalen Dev-Instanzen nicht testen. Was für mich 'zählt', ist, was auf Q deployed wird/ist.
Die Implementierung auf Q ist bis dato nicht wie spezifiziert erfolgt (vgl. weiter oben).

Thx Mark

Please merge it as discussed to branch v2.0.21 for next Q deployment, set it on fix and set correct fix version.
Thx.

attachment.name: Distrelec Schweiz _ Bester Online Shop für Elektronik_2014-08-04_10-04-55.png
attachment.author: mdiggelmann

attachment.name: Distrelec Switzerland Best Online Shop for Electronics - Google Chrome_2014-08-04_13-05-13.png
attachment.author: rroman

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Benötige $

{feedbackTextTop}

in campaign-feedback.jsp als einzelne Properities, damit ich das Tracking einbauen kann. Aber es scheint, als wäre der Banner als HTML Hinterlegt -> keine einzelnen Properities möglich. Richtig?

Infos zur Banner Implementation: https://jira.namics.com/browse/DISTRELEC-1258

Im FACT-Finder Backend wird das komplette Markup eines Feedback-Text-Banners gepflegt.

Beispiel URL:
http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=Telefon

Im FACT-Finder definiertes HTML:
<a href="http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Computer-%26-Hobby/Netzwerk-und-Telekommunikation/Mobiltelefone-Zubeh%C3%B6r/Smartphones-Mobiltelefone/c/cat-39417?q=*&filter_Category3=Mobiltelefone+%2F+Zubeh%C3%B6r&filter_Buyable=1&filter_Category4=Smartphones%2FMobiltelefone&wt_mc=ch.faf-c.de.-" title="Mobiles" ><img src="/medias/sys_master/hef/h1b/8822097149982/FF-AT-DE-feedback-mobile.png" alt="mobile"></a>

Hi Mark

Das Tracking für die Feedback Campaign (siehe DISTRELEC-2482) muss direkt in einem HTML Snippet eingebaut werden, welches auf dem Fact Finder eingespielt wird.

Das HTML Snippet welches Cornel gepostet hat muss also um Webtrekk Attribute ergänzt werden und dann von einem Software Engineer auf de Fact Finder eingespielt werden.

Please implement as specified in the attached .doc-file

Thx Mark
Estimated FE work: 1d
Attribute "name" added to the link as specified in the .doc file

Hi Ruben

Tested on http://test.distrelec.ch/search?q=usb

Please compare the attached screenshot in this regard: The name-tag seems to be populated as specified within the Browser Add-on however not in the source-code itself (indicated in red). Please verify and refactor.

Thx Mark

Hello Mark,

what I did is modifying dynamically the DOM. The page source can't be changed (is an HTML file). Because the HREF link element comes from back end, "feedbackTextTop" element:

<div class="feedbackTop">$

{feedbackTextTop}

</div>

Have you tested it with webtrekk? Probably it works fine with this DOM manipulation.
If not working, we have to go for a backend solution.

Thanks,
Ruben

Unfortunately this implementation-approach is not working. By cklicking on the according item no corresponding tracking call is fired. That is also why the event-id is not reported in Webtrekk.
Therefore please involve BE accordingly.

Thx Mark

Hello Florian,
could you please assign the ticket to the BE guys?
Thanks,
Ruben

Hi Mark,

I changed the way how the tracking is done. The trigger was the name attribute before, and maybe the Webtrekk was looking for those links, before the name attribute was set by JS, so it was probably a timing issue. Now I changed it to a clicklistener, which triggers the webtrekk call. On my local Machine, I can see the call now.

could you please retest after the next deployment.

Thanks, Jan
